caption: We've eaten here three times so far. The food is not inexpensive but it is reasonably priced for the quality and taste, and the experience. Their tea and coffee are excellent! The young woman who waited on us was sweet and attentive. The owner is very friendly and welcoming. Well worth visiting, especially if you want to experience real English food.

My family and I were amazed at this place when we came here in August. We came here again and we still love it! Excellent food and both the owner and the waitress are very nice! I just wish they didn't enforce the masks. Other than that, the place is excellent!!!
I very much enjoy the dishes and service, excellent location right next to where I live. The employees are always very welcoming. Would recommend to others.
Great tea, great food and amazing staff!
The owner was nice and attentive. The atmosphere was quaint and cute.
I happened upon this gem while exploring downtown. You can sit down and have a pot of tea for a reasonable price. And the owner is friendly and British.
This place is becoming one of our regular stupid when passing through Frederick. It's a nice place to drop to get a drink and a snack.

Good tea. This place has such a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The owners are the type of people who make you feel at home in such a way that you will want to become a regular, and a friend. The garden is simply a haven. I will be visiting any and every time I am back in the area.

The restaurant wasn't supposed to be open today, but Michael, the owner, saw me looking in the window and said he'd open for us since I said I was interested in the haggis. Had a great meal and an even better conversation! What a really great guy and a wonderful little spot in downtown Frederick! Highly recommend
Such a beautiful place with a small charming  garden. The food is good. Highly recommend.
I just had an amazing time there with my girlfriend, the tea and the food are delicious and the experience in the garden very unique, will come back.

Lovely, lovely place! Michael is kind and attentive.  You can order a big pot of hot tea with cream and sugar and it’s served in delicate cups and saucers—this is everything I want in a tea room.  There are gluten free options available as far as food, including a satisfying shepherd’s pie. I highly recommend the gluten free scones with clotted cream and lemon curd.  I’ve been here many times and it’s always been a fantastic experience. Good for a date or spending time with family members.

Service was perfect.  Owners are friendly.  The backyard garden is peaceful and lovely.  There was a point in the tea service where I shut my eyes, just so I could drown out everything but the bite in my mouth.   I'll come back a lot.
Adorable, charming little spot with a friendly owner and delicious home made treats.
Oh, it has been so many years since I've been here. I moved away and haven't found anything like it where I am now. The owner is so kind and gracious. Amazing tea, British meals, and hospitality.
Micheal is a wonderfully pleasant host! The garden/patio is a very nice place to enjoy a good meal.
Had a wonderful Britain experience with the ambience, food and owner. The owner made us feel at home, service dog friendly, and delicious food.
The best tea experience in frederick. Small business and you're treated like old friends. The service is amazing & food is tasty

The selection of regional meals was wonderful. We had the Shepherd's pie and it was equal to the best I've ever had in Ireland. The tea was excellent and the same brand I enjoyed there. Then the homemade scones with cream and jam--- Yum!
We moved back after living in England for a few years and this is authentic British food.  The scones were amazing and the pies and sausage rolls were delicious.  Highly recommend!!

Great spot for a bit of authentic British fare in a cozy spot. I had a lovely afternoon tea and my hubby tried the haggis and mash as well as the steak and potato pie. Everything was delicious. The lemon curd is homemade and absolutely to die for! The owner, Michael, is very friendly and welcoming and the waitress was very attentive. Can't wait to visit again.
Absolutely delightful afternoon tea.   Very traditional, delicious, and really nice service.  Thank you!
If you're looking for a proper pork pie, this is the place.

This place is truly exceptional. Everything we tried was tasty and authentic (and we tried a lot), the owner was incredibly friendly. The lemon curd is some of the best I've had. The garden out back is peaceful and so lovely. It was so good we went back the next day! Check it out!!
Great afternoon tea. Food and service were excellent. Nice atmosphere.
wonderful!

fish and chips and gooey peas, are are good i literally could've eaten 2 orders.  my women seemed content with tea tasting with little sandwiches / pastries. kept them talking amongst themselves. i was actually able to hold my granddaughter and talk to Michael.  five stars
The tea is extremely rare and cannot be matched with any other tea really a great place to visit

We had a wonderful afternoon with a pot of tea, delicious scones, Cornish pasties, sausage rolls, and other treats. The owner is so nice and the service was  excellent! Can't wait to go again for a full proper afternoon tea.. you can't go wrong with a visit!
Michael is always friendly and the food has been great every time we've gone
Sweet little teashop with authentic high tea.
Favorite, authentic English tea room in Frederick. Owner operated, serving and cooking those meals and delightful delicacies. English grocery items also available for purchase.

I'll definitely be back, and I live over an hour away! The gentleman who runs this place is extremely friendly and accommodating. There's a gorgeous garden out back with plenty of seating for larger groups. We had English tea and an assortment of sweets/pastries and loved all of it. If you're looking for something nice to pair with the tea, try the scone with lemon curd. The menu seems traditionally English which is a fun change of pace from other cafes. Coming here is an awesome way to spend part of a day!

Highly recommended if you are a tea drinker and homemade pastries. The cafe is owned by a very hospital couple. Drinking some British tea in authentic British cups and saucers, with a peaceful sound background of two water fountains in a cozy backyard make everything perfect to enjoy your time  there. The garden is beautifully manicured and shows good care behind it. When we were leaving, the owner was getting ready to make ready the dough for the next day's pastries. Good feeling!
Cafe Anglais is my favorite place to ease my mind. It's quite peaceful the employee are always a delight.
Have been going here for years and loving it. Michael, the owner, is a delight to chat with, and the food is excellent and completely British.  Five stars!
What a lovely owner.  Went in for tea, haggis and blood sausage and he brought it a plate that was full of homemade goodness.  Tea was perfect , of course.
Great place for English food in Frederick.

I celebrated my birthday there with eight friends. We took up half the room in the store, but with a reservation it was no problem. The food and tea was amazing and the owner is so kind. Definetly a place to go if youre in the area.
A quaint little place to feel British in cute Frederick.  Black tea served in a porcelain pot with matching cups? And pasties for about $7? Amazing.

I went here with some friends for tea on a Sunday afternoon.  I have been to other tea houses and this one didn't rank very high.  I was disappointed that they did not offer a selection of teas to choose from.  When we were seated we were told that we only had a choice of a black tea or a decaf tea.  The other tea houses I have gone to had several dozens to choose from, and each person could have their own pot.  The food selection was small.  However they did have a couple of #CeliacFriendly offerings.  I had a gluten free scone and a gluten free shepherds pie.  These were pretty good and I found them to be #CeliacFriendly.
Lovely place for high tea 👸
This cafe is quite fun and pleasant. I've been here at least twice (from out of town). The owner is very friendly. I had one of the "British pies" along with rambutan and it hit the spot!

We go to Cafe Anglais several times a year and it remains one of our very favorite restaurants in the Frederick area. It's a small, charming British tea room with whimsical paintings on the wall and a picture of Queen Elizabeth looming large in the room. We invariably get the Shepherd's Pie with Mushy Peas, as we did today, which is always delicious. The British tea is great and is served in a decorative pot with matching cups. I always buy a box to take home, usually Yorkshire brand which I enjoy the most.  We go during the week which is not as busy as the weekend so we can talk with the owner, Michael Harrison, a native Englishman who enjoys sitting down with his customers to chat just like he would any friend. We really look forward to talking to him when he's not too busy. In nice weather, there's charming garden out back which is a nice spot to have lunch.  We've tried other menu items such as the Fish and Chips, Bangers and Mash which are good, but always come back to the Shepherd's Pie (lamb) or Cottage Pie (beef). Desserts including eclairs and scones are made by Michael and are very good also.

This is a charming tea room on the main drag in downtown Frederick.  Run by real Brits, you can see the level of effort put into their food and drink offerings.  The tea was prepared just about perfectly for my taste, and the food was quite good; their beef and kidney pie and their shepherd's pie were both tasty.  The interior is small but pleasant; you could hear the Premier League game from the kitchen area.  Even better, their food items can be purchased to go at a discount; I bought six of their pies.  The only downside for me was that the temperature inside was too high; I left the place bathed in sweat. (Of course, drinking hot tea didn't help.) Still, this is a delightful little place, with a friendly and chatty proprietor, and a worthy addition to the Market Street shops and restaurants.

Wife and I had lived in England for a few years and tea houses were one of the things we missed. We decided to try a couple and we started here. I ordered a small quiche and regretted it almost immediately. I will only order the large one from now on. The food is made fresh and I simply couldn't get enough of it. It is a relaxed environment, no fast food, so plan on it being a longer affair. The owner is really nice. We sat down inside and he talked to us for a couple minutes while our scones were baking. He encouraged us to enjoy the seating in the garden for the last half of our meal and it was great, very relaxing. Final thoughts. If you are looking for a quick meal, this is not the place to go. Come here to relax and enjoy time with good friends and good food.
Always pleasant.

An incredible cute little sit down area. Good prices. For the full tea experience call a day ahead. The owner makes it all. The pies, pastys, and scones where all delicious. The tea was excellent. Amazing hosts. Loved it!

I absolutely love this place and wish I lived close enough to come more often. Delicious food proves that British food is actually quite tasty! The scones are soft and tasty and scrumptious. They even have decaf tea, which means I can have a cuppa without getting a migraine.

Tjis place served probably the closest to a real British food I have had in the US. Tea served in proper teacups or mugs brewed in a teapot. Mash was moist and tasted real potatoes. Pasties were warm and buttery the filling was tasty. You really shouldn't leave the place havung at least one of the desserts  (or be a devil amd have two) on the menu. We hope to be back when we are near Frederick for sure!
This was a great spot for mother's day! Tea in the outside courtyard was lovely.  The service was a little spotty though.
Nice outdoor tea garden. It was a little chilly while we were here, but excellent Irish breakfast.
Lovely little shop! I always make an effort to stop by for a bite and a cup of tea. The atmosphere is very welcoming and friendly. You feel like a part of the Cafe Anglais family.
Michael's English. He knows what he's doing. Everything is authentic, and not pretentious! Don't ask him what tea he's serving. He'll tell you "good English tea!" Stuff is not over-priced.
We didn't try the food but it looked and smelled great. We'll definitely try the food next visit to Fredrick. Also, on a nice day, check hang out in the back yard.

Good tea - tasty comfort food - friendly owner  The tea is standard black tea, but it's good and doesn't leave that tannis flavor in your mouth.  The food is British comfort food: cottage pies, fish and chips, bangers and mash, etc. They were medium portions, and they were very tasty! My wife loved the scone, which is plain but moist.  The owner was personable and engaging. He talked with us and we never felt rushed.  Come here for afternoon tea and scones or a tasty lunch! A little slice of England in downtown Frederick.
The service was great and so was the athomsphere
Tea was delicious.  Fish and chips on point.  So wonderfully casual and unpretentious.
A great place!  I enjoy the food and the English tea.
Café Anglais is always a delight~from the atmosphere to the delicious delicacies Michael prepares! Have taken both family and friends and it's become our favorite Tea Room experience.
Such a nice place to take home partner for her birthday! The owner was so nice to us and got the whole place to sing to her over our scones! Go for the afternoon tea.
Nice English experience.  British products you won't find elsewhere.
Try the mushy peas!

Warm and cozy place with reasonable priced British menu and friendly service. Great chicken and mushroom pie in individual serving size. An ideal place for friends to catch up with a pot of tea while shopping in downtown Frederick.
Great cozy and warm tea house. Owner visited our table a couple times to make sure we were comfortable.
Great food - great atmosphere.  Eat there everytime we come to this area!
Was so happy to see the full Irish breakfast on the menu

Quaint little English style cafe that servers a very good traditional breakfast with very good tea and biscuits.  Wonderfully delightful proprietors who offer fantastic service and charming conversation if you are so inclined.
Divine atmosphere and food to match. Perfect on a rainy day for a cup of tea and a biscuit!

We love Michael and his shop. The whole place is just a few tables and Michael hopping back and forth from the kitchen. Everything is made with care and it is all delicious. We drop in whenever we can, whenever the mood strikes for real comfort food, British style. Definitely recommended!

So I'm an expat living in Maryland and it's tough to get authentic UK food freshly cooked. I really wanted this place to be good. I really did, but alas, it's only alright. Alright-ish.  I ordered an Irish breakfast which consisted of eggs, bacon, sausage, beans, fried bread, black & white pudding & tomatoes. The sausage was horrid, the bacon was American, not Irish, the black pudding was OK but under seasoned.  For those of you who want an authentic UK breakfast, try Brain Boru in Severna Park MD.  I also took home a frozen pork pie and some frozen sausage rolls. The pork pie was bland. The puff pastry on the sausage rolls was great, but again, the meat inside was horrid.  For those of you who crave a decent pork pie, I heartily recommend you google "the british pork pie company". Those guys nail it.  Atmosphere completely reminded me of an awkward trip to my grandparents when I was younger.  To sum up: it's OK but don't expect any authentic flavors (with the exception of the Heinz baked beans).

A small group of us had tea here.  There is nothing pretentious about Michael's tea at cafe Anglais.  No "Frou-Frou" no soup, salad or fruit as most teas are served in Maryland.  However, it is the closest this English gal has had to a tea at home at Mum's in the US!!  The big pots of tea were made with Irish Breakfast.  I like a strong tea so this was not quite as strong as I would have liked but my American friends seemed to enjoy it.  The sandwiches were fresh made with simple ingredients.  The scone was wonderful with "real" Devon cream not the pseudo cream most tea shops serve.  The cakes and cookies were just the right size with Cadbury's biscuits and a dense homemade shortbread.  Lovely!!  The tea was made extra more special by the garden location.  With 3 fountains it was serene and peaceful in the middle of downtown Frederick.  Heaven!!!   Can’t wait to try his pie & mushy peas!!!
